lexUnit.name: emanate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: issue or spread out from a source.

sentence.text: It can not be used , therefore , in respect of odours emanating from residential premises .
It may be due to two or more separate odours , emanating from two or more works , combining to give rise to a statutory nuisance .
He sat next to me and I wrinkled my nose at the sweaty odour emanating from the long , black , food-stained gown he wore .
Banging sounds emanating from the boiler may be due to a build-up of scale or to air being drawn into the system .
A terrible roaring sound began to emanate from the doomed building , and the bystanders were ordered to get well away .
The sound of merriment emanating from the hall jangled her nerves , the sight of the courting couples pressed against the wall was enough to bring her to the edge of tears again .
The CCBE has done a great deal behind the scenes to fend off some of the battier ideas emanating from the European Commission .
A fawnlike innocence emanated from her , as if she might melt at any moment into the misty forest behind her .
The stomach had begun to swell and the chamber stank with the evil gases which emanated from it .

` Radon gas , emanating from radium in the soil , is present at high concentrations in soil gases and enters homes though unpaved basements and through wet and porous structural materials , " Martell says .
And when the minute grubs hatch , they are immediately attracted , through some as yet unidentified sense organs , to the scent of mustard oil emanating from the roots .
Because he seemed to feel the question emanating from this tall blond stranger 's icy-blue eyes .
Regarding the environment , there are impractical proposals emanating via Brussels , designed merely to placate noisy pressure groups .
A wave of cold seemed to emanate through the funereal drapery .
I haul in the bags -- which emanate , it would seem , from the monstrous jaws , the industrial violence , of the garbage truck .
